description: Venezuela has decreed a "state of alarm" across the country that is valid for 30 days.
Venezuelas executive president Maduro declared the state of alarm on March 13th which will allow to put into action the dramatic measures to come

Venezuela announced on April 11th that it would be prolonging its state of emergency for another 30 days starting from April 12th This extension will allow the government to continue enforcing the national lockdown among other measures

description: Venezuela's government conducted a survey among 7 millions of its inhabitants via its Patria App in order to analyze the impact of the lockdown and the situation in regard to the Covid-19 pandemic. It was announced on March 16th and the various results of the survey were presented on April 26th.

description: The vice-president of Venezuela announced on March 19th that starting on March 21 a massive screening campaign will start throughout the country, also thanks to the reception of 4000 testing kits.

The vice-president of Venezuela announced on March 19th that starting on March 21 a massive screening campaign will start throughout the country, also thanks to the reception of 4000 testing kits.
New: On May 11th it was announced by Venezuela's vice-president that a second phase of mass testing would initiate on May 12th.

Venezuela's Interior Ministry Nestor Reverol on Friday, March 13th, said the government would provide border control authorities with face masks, gloves and thermometers, without mentioning supplies to for citizens and hospitals.

description: The Venezuelan Ministry of Health approved on March 18th the certification of the microbiology laboratory of the University of Los Andes (ULA), located in Mérida, for the performance of tests that detect the presence of COVID -19. This will be the second laboratory in the country where these tests will be done.

description: Venezuela announced on March 13th the obligation to use face masks for all passengers using the subway system in the capital of Caracas. All passengers not complying with this measure will be banned from accessing the metro enforced by the National Bolivarian Police (NBP), the Service of Communal Police and the National Bolivarian Guard (GNB) starting on March 14th.

The Venezuelan Government reported on March 15th that it will start a mass disinfection campaign that carries out intense cleaning throughout the national territory as part of health management to prevent COVID-19.

Venezuela announced on April 17th a restriction of movement in and out of the municipalities of Gómez and Maneiro in the state of Nueva Esparta starting from that same day due to a virus outbreak there.
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: On June 22, Venezuela is enforcing special containment barriers for the following 10 states: Capitol District, La Guaira, Miranda, Aragua, Zulia, Táchira, Apure, Bolívar, Lara, and Trujillo. These measures focus on the closure of roads and rail systems, as well as continued quarantine measures. The “circulation through the main highways and highways” of those 10 states will be prevented.

Venezuela announced on March 15th a lockdown called social quarantine in 6 Venezuelan states in addition to the capital district Caracas starting from March 16th at 5AM until further notice Only essential workers such as law enforcement health and transportation personnel in addition military and food supply workers are exempted

Essential business workers as well as law enforcement and health personnel are exempted.

description:

As of May 30th a new phase-out plan (dubbed as dynamic relaxation) has been presented which will start on June 1st.

description:

Update: On April 12th, Venezuela extended the "social quarantine" for 30 days. This applies to all 23 states and Caracas. All activities will remain suspended except for food, health, transport, and security services

description:
New policy: Venezuela's president Maduro announced on April 24th a phase-out measure, in which adults older than 65 years old will be able to leave their house on April 27th, from 8am to 12pm. Children will be able to leave their house to exercise and do physical activities from 2pm to 6pm on April 28th. 
Old Policy: Venezuela announced on March 16th an extension of the lockdown (dubbed as social quarantine) to the entire country, comprising all remaining states, starting on March 17th at 5AM until further notice. Essential business workers as well as law enforcement and health personnel are exempted.
compliance: Mandatory with Legal Penalties (Jail Time),Mandatory with Fines,Mandatory with Exceptions (Please list exceptions in the text entry)

Old policy: Venezuela announced on March 16th an extension of the lockdown (dubbed as social quarantine) to the entire country, comprising all remaining states, starting on March 17th at 5AM until further notice. description: Venezeula's 7+7 plan is still in effect. 21 states of the country have been moved to Phase 2, which reopens all 24 economic sectors, including Mérida, Monagas, Trujillo, Carabobo, Yaracuy, Guárico, Portuguesa, Cojedes, Amazonas, Sucre, Nueva Esparta, Anzoátegui, Barinas, Aragua, Lara, Delta Amacuro, Falcón, as well as, Zulia, Bolívar, Táchira, Apure (excluding the bordering municipalities). Caracas, La Guaira and Miranda are still under Phase 1 – partial flexibility.

Venezuela is beginning its new 77 Plus plan on October 8 This still includes the 7 days of flexibility for the economic sectors followed by 7 days of complete quarantine This plan is focused more on treatment methods for COVID19 starting with clinical trials of Sputnik V Border municipalities in Zulia Apure Táchira Bolivar and Delta Amacuro are exempted
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units within one or more countries

description: Venezuela's council of state declares itself in state of emergency and permanent session on March 31st. The state council serves as a major advisor to the president and will from now supervise the situation of the pandemic.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration

description: Venezuela's council of state declares itself in permanent session to coordinate the Covid-19 response, starting the 31st of March 2020.
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
type_sub_cat: Existing government entity given new powers

description: Venezuela's interim government, led by the president of Venezuela's National Assembly, Juan Guaidó, started a public awareness campaign on March 16th through multiple channels, to inform the population about the prevention mechanisms of contagion.
type_sub_cat: Both Disseminating and Gathering information related to COVID-19

description: Venezuela required on March 14th that all passengers that had arrived from Europe during March to quarantine for at least two weeks

description:
Venezuela's president presented on May 30th the new model that will be applied from June 1 throughout the national territory, within the framework of the 1st phase of "dynamic flexibility" of quarantine; excepting the border municipalities that will maintain their respective curfews.
Venezuelan model is dubbed as 5 x 10: 5 days of flexibilization and 10 consecutive days of social quarantine. The phase out measure is only targeted at specific economic sectors.

The Venezuelan Institution for regulating the Banking sector (SUDEBAN) decreed the nationwide suspension of banking activities on March 15th, thus imposing a restriction on private and public banking business activities starting from March 16th. 
This measure has been partly lifted, as banking activities are resumed for certain hours of the day, as part of the nationwide "dynamic flexibility" phase-out model.
type_sub_cat: Financial service activities except insurance and pension funding

description: Venezuela's cardinal Baltazar Porras, announced on March 15th that all ecclesiastic activities would be suspended until further notice, but that places of worship remained open.
type_sub_cat: Attendance at religious services restricted (e.g. mosque/church closings)

description: Venezuela has restricted mass gatherings starting March 15 until further notice.
Starting on March 22nd, Venezuela has made it mandatory to wear face masks in public areas for all individuals. Police have been deployed to ensure people are sticking to quarantine measures.
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere

description: The Venezuelan Governments ordered on April 16th to wear masks outside in any public space in addition to the previous order to wear them while using public transportation
